properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Valencia Creek - Channel Track. 

  • There is a bushfire located in the Avon Mt Hedrick Scenic Reserve that is contained.
  • The bushfire is located in the area of walking tracks near the Channels, north of the Channel Track picnic area.
  • The Channel Loop walking track is closed to the public while firefighters and aircraft continue to attend to this fire.
  • The community is asked to avoid the area and keep the local roads clear.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by FFMVic.

The next update is expected by 19/12/2024 09:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Barton, Jimmy Creek, Kia Ora, Mafeking, Moyston, Watgania, Willaura, Willaura North, Bellfield, Bornes Hill, Grampians, Pomonal, Stavely
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Barton, Bellfield, Bornes Hill, Grampians, Jimmy Creek, Kia Ora, Mafeking, Moyston, Pomonal, Stavely, Watgania, Willaura, Willaura North.

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
  • Fire is expected to impact the western side of Grampians Tourist Road within the next hour. 
  • It is travelling north-westerly direction and has crossed Yarram Gap Road, and has not impacted private property.
  • Spot fires and embers are starting fires ahead of the main fire. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads. 
Road Closures:
  •  Grampians Tourist Road, is closed from Jimmy Creek Road to the southern Victoria Valley Road intersection. 
  • Victoria Valley Road is closed between Mirranatwa Road and Grampians Tourist Road.
  • Yarram Gap Road is closed from Grampians Tourist Road to Moyston-Dunkeld Road.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
Grampians National Park visitor information and closures: 
  • The southern part of the Grampians National Park, including the Grampians Peaks trail is closed from Jimmy Creek to Dunkeld. The areas north of Jimmy Creek remain open. 
  • Wannon Crossing campground is closed.
  • All walking tracks and campgrounds in the southern area are closed

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 18/12/2024 06:50 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Waggarandall, Yabba North, Youanmite.

  • There is a grassfire at Gawne Road Yabba North that is under control.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice Message issued at 1.29pm today. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. Find information on protecting yourself and your family: https://www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/am-i-at-risk/grassfires-rural.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 18/12/2024 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app

  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Dean, Springmount, Wattle Flat.

  • There is a bushfire at Melbourne Rd, Creswick that is contained.
  • There is low level fire activity within containment lines. 
  • Smoke will still be visible to surrounding communities.  
  • Crews and aircraft will continue to work in the area. 
You should stay informed, monitor conditions and stay away from the area.

To help ensure the safety of our emergency personnel do not fly drones over the fire area. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 

Road Closures:
  • Creswick-Dean Road is closed between Melbourne Road and Skilbecks Road 
  • Melbourne Road is closed between Creswick-Dean Road and Russells Reservoir

Residents wanting to access their property on a closed road can do so by showing their licence at the closest Traffic Management Point. Residents are not permitted to move through the fire area. 

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Replacement fencing information
  • Farm fencing adjoining state or national parks:
The Victorian Government will pay half of the cost of boundary fencing upgrades, up to $5,000 per kilometre to replace or repair fencing between private land and all national parks and state forests destroyed or damaged by bushfires.

  • Farm fencing destroyed by firefighting activities:
The Government will  pay 100% of the restoration costs of fences damaged on private land as a result of machinery used by fire agencies to control bushfires, or fire agency staff cutting through fences to allow access for suppression efforts.
A dedicated fencing coordinator from DEECA will help landowners decide what option will suit them and arrange payment.
An assessment of the property and the fence damage must be completed before works are undertaken or any payments can be made, and landholders will continue to pay labour costs and half the cost of materials. 
Landholders can call find more information on the Department of Energy Environment and Climate Action website or by calling the Contact Centre Team on 136 186, Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 6:00pm.

Djuwang Baring, Creswick Trails is closed Wednesday 18 December 2024

Community Newsletter:
Please find a link to the Creswick Community Newsletter

Firefighting vehicles and machinery will be moving around in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 18/12/2024 06:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Coonooer West, Dooboobetic .

  • This Community Information message replaces the Community Information issued at 5:22 pm Friday 13 December.
  • The haystack fire at Valpine Road, Coonooer West remains contained.
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities as firefighters pull apart the hay to extinguish the fire.
  • This fire may continue to burn for several days.
  • Firefighters will continue to monitor the fire.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this may be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road. 
  • It is strongly recommended you Prepare to Leave. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampian, that is not yet under control. 
  • Fire is expected to impact the western side of Grampians Tourist Road within the next hour. 
  • It is travelling north-westerly direction and has crossed Yarram Gap Road, and has not impacted private property.
  • Spot fires and embers are starting fires ahead of the main fire.

Relief centre is now open at "Sterling Place" at 14 Sterling Place, Dunkeld.
Prepare to Leave immediately. Leave as soon as you are ready, as roads will become busy as people leave.
What you should do:
  • Monitor the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can mean the situation is worsening.
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • If you are not prepared, leave now. Dont wait until it is too late - leave early. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return.
If you are leaving, pack: 
  • Cash 
  • Clothing for three days 
  • Medicine for three days 
  • Phone and chargers 
  • Toiletries 
  • Important documents 
  • Meaningful items and photos 
  • Pet essentials, including leash and carriers.
Check on your neighbours if it is safe.

Check the VicTraffic website for road closures.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 

Where to go:
  • Friends or family away from the fire. 
  • Consider roads may become busy closer to the time of impact. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can start spot fires and embers can travel large distances ahead of the main fire.
Road Closures: 
  • Grampians Tourist Road, is closed from Jimmy Creek Road to the southern Victoria Valley Road intersection. 
  • Victoria Valley Road is closed between Mirranatwa Road and Grampians Tourist Road.
  • Yarram Gap Road is closed from Grampians Tourist Road to Moyston-Dunkeld Road.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.


Grampians National Park visitor information and closures: 
  • The southern part of the Grampians National Park, including the Grampians Peaks trail is closed from Jimmy Creek to Dunkeld. 
  • The areas north of Jimmy Creek remain open.
  • Wannon Crossing campground is closed.All walking tracks and campgrounds in the southern area are closed.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 18/12/2024 06:30 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

        Prepare to Leave immediately. Leave as soon as you are   ready, as roads will become busy as people leave.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Glenisla. 

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Goat Track that is under control.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Grampians National Park - Goat Track
Issue Date: Wednesday 18 December 2024, 11:54 am
Next Update: Saturday 21 December 2024, 12:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35017/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Glenisla. 

- There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Goat Track that is under control.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning is being issued for Grampians, Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
Private Property in the Mirrantwa area could be impacted anytime within the next 1.5 to 3 hours.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians Road in a North-Westerly direction towards Victoria Valley Road. 
Relief centre is now open at "Sterling Place" at 14 Sterling Place, Dunkeld.
Leaving immediately is the safest option, before conditions become too dangerous. 

Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
What you should do: 

Travel to: 
  • The home of family or friends that is away from the warning area.
  • You should leave using Victoria Valley Road and head towards Dunkeld. Relief centre is being established at Sterling Place, 14 Sterling Place, Dunkeld.
  • When you leave remember to take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.

In the car: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety.
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you are unable to leave you should shelter indoors:
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents. Turn off cooling systems.
  • You must take shelter before the fire arrives. The extreme heat is likely to kill you well before the flames reach you.
  • Shelter in a room that has two exits, such as a door or window including one directly to the outside. It is important to be able to see outside so you know what is happening with the fire. 
  • If your home catches on fire and the conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. 

If you cannot get indoors, other last resort options include:
  • Shelter in the middle of a large open area like a ploughed paddock, football oval or sporting reserve.
  • Get into a large body of water like a dam, lake, river, the ocean or inground pool.
  • Try to protect yourself from the fire's heat.

If you are caught in fire in your car:
  • Park behind a solid structure to block the fire's heat or pull over to cleared area.
  • Try to position the car towards the approaching fire.
  • Turn on your hazard lights and headlights.
  • Close all windows.
  • Turn off the air-conditioning and shut all the air vents.
  • Turn your car engine off.
  • Get down as low as possible below window level and cover up with a pure woollen blanket.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Embers are starting small fires ahead of the main fire.

Road Closures: 
  • Grampians Tourist Road, is closed from Jimmy Creek Road to the southern Victoria Valley Road intersection. 
  • Victoria Valley Road is closed at the Victoria Point Intersection. 
  • Yarram Gap Road is closed from Grampians Tourist Road to Moyston-Dunkeld Road.
This messages was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 18/12/2024 04:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Incident Location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road
Issue Date: Wednesday 18 December 2024, 02:39 pm
Next Update: Wednesday 18 December 2024, 04:40 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35028/moreinfo

This Emergency Warning is being issued for Grampians, Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley. 
- There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
Private Property in the Mirrantwa area could be impacted anytime within the next 1.5 to 3 hours.
- The bushfire is travelling from Grampians Road in a North-Westerly direction towards Victoria Valley Road. 

Relief centre is now open at "Sterling Place" at 14 Sterling Place, Dunkeld. 

Leaving immediately is the safest option, before conditions become too dangerous. 

Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
